attributes.title: Stock Verification.
attributes.description:
The stock exercise showed the following:

  • Bread stock had a variance of-6 Pieces,
  • Polybags had -1,835,
  • White flour had-37.70 Kgs,
  • Yeast -3.75 sachets.
  • Utto had -2.95Kgs.

Below is a detailed summary of the findings:
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to enhance controls by ensuring proper recording on movement of raw materials is done to minimize the noted variations.
attributes.effect: Variances noted in stock items implies that stock movement controls are not working effectively.

value: We will do a follow up to ensure proper recording on movement of raw materials, packing materials and finished product to reduce the noted variations.
I urge the team to enhance controls on movement of packing materials by conducting regular stocks to minimize the noted variations.
In the prior audit period poly bags had a variance of +642 pieces and finished product had +26 pieces, other raw materials had insignificant variations.
Current
A physical stock count was done on 16/06/2025,to determine if physical  stock items were matching with the records as per SAP.
Significant negative variations in polybags movement showed there is need for branch to strengthen polybags movement controls.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if stock movement controls were designed appropriately and was working effectively to minimize risks of misstatements and fraud.

attributes.title: Bread weights
attributes.description: Bread weights check was as seen below:
attributes.recommendation:
Branch management to ensure correct production procedures are followed to eliminate lapses i.e overcooling, over proofing that will result in underweights bread.

Branch to also ensure baking tins are in good condition/ensure tins requisition is done on time.
attributes.effect:
Underweights exposes the company to risk of non compliance with the standards weights.

Underweights deny the customers value for their money.

value:
Underweights noted in 400 barrel was due to worn out tins and overproofing.

We will do a requisition of the baking tins and i will also do a follow up to ensure cooling time is followed to eliminate instances of underweight bread.

There is need for strict follow up of the set of SOP by supervisor and manager to ensure production procedures are followed.
Also manager to enhance spot checks on dough weight to ensure correct weight finished product is sent to the market.

In the prior audit dated 21/05/2025,Underweights were as seen below:

400 CTW had 13%

400 Barrel had 34%

600 BT had 13%

800 BT had 14%
Current
A spot check on packed Bread ready to be dispatched to the market was done on 16/06/025.
Underweights noted especially in 400 Barrel shows there was lapse in follow up of correct production procedures and this need to be checked and worked on.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if the branch was producing bread of correct weight as per the KEBS requirements.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis.
attributes.description: The analysis showed the following:
attributes.recommendation: Sales team to onboard more customers to ensure branch production capacity is utilized.
attributes.effect:
Production capacity was not achieved which means there is still room for improvement.

No remixes implies that the branch is producing bread of good quality.

value: Branch production is dependent on branch sales.
Production planning is done based on sales besides ,we have been giving support to D3 .

In the prior audit period dated 21/05/2025 mixing chart analysis showed the  following:

  • Average yield was at 192.86 bags
  • Utto consumption to bags was 1:1.
  • Average production was 91.11 bags equivalent to 93% of branch utilization.
  • 744 Pieces were noted.
Current
An analysis of both Mixing Chart and mixing chart summary was done for a period of 32 days from 16/05/2025 to 16/06/2025.

Branch production capacity was underutilized.

Raw materials consumption was as per the set BOM.
Operations/Production Department

To determine if raw materials consumption was as per the set BOM.

To determine if branch production capacity was being fully utilized.

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description: It was noted that production efficiency stood at 4.47 which above the KPI of 4.3 Bags per production worker as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: Branch to maintain production efficiency and improve further.
attributes.effect: Branch production workers are being fully utilized.

value: Branch production efficiency to be maintained.
There is improvement from prior performance to enforce compliance through enhanced supervision.
In the prior audit dated 21/05/2025 it was noted that production efficiency was at 3.95 bags per production worker.
Current
An analysis of production efficiency was done for a period of 32 days from 16th may 2025 -16th June 2025.
Production efficiency of 4.3 was achieved.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if production workers were attaining their KPI of 4.3 bags per production worker.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency
attributes.description:
The analysis showed that packing efficiency stood at 92.79 crates which was below the KPI of 97 crates.

Below is a detailed summary of the findings:
attributes.recommendation:
Branch management to ensure allocation of packers is done as per the prior shift loaves produced.

Enhance supervision on slicing area to ensure packers are attaining their KPI of 97 crates per packer.
attributes.effect: Packing efficiency not achieved implies that the branch hired 19 excess workers with ab extra cost of 17328.

value: We will put more effort to improve to recommended efficiency.
There is improvement from  prior performance manager to enforce compliance through improved supervision.
In the prior audit dated 21/05/2025,it was noted that packing efficiency stood at 93.65 crates per packer.
Current
An analysis of packing efficiency was done for a period of 32 days from 16th May 2025-16th June 2025.
Branch Slicers did not attain their efficiency.
Operations/Production Department

To determine if Packers attained their KPI OF 97 Crated per packer.

To determine if packers allocation is done as per the branch needs.

attributes.title: Damages analysis.
attributes.description:
It was noted that production damages stood at 0.28% which was above the allowable limit 0.2% of total production while market damages stood at 0.49% which was within the allowable limits of 0.5% of total sales as seen below:

Production Damages.

N/B. The analysis is exclusive of 91 pieces of Oven damages.

Market damages.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to ensure bread of good quality is being produced to eliminate instances of excess damages.
attributes.effect: Excess production damages implies that branch was producing bread not meeting the quality standards.

value: We  will do a follow up to ensure best quality bread is produced to ensure damages are within the allowable limits.
We emphasize on quality and production process controls
In the prior audit it was noted that production damages stood at 0.29% of total production while market damages stood at 0.46% of total sales.
Current
An analysis of production and market damages was done for a period of 32 days from 16/05/2025-16/06/2025.

Market damages within allowable limits shows proper handling of bread by sales team.

Excess production damages shows  that production procedures are not being followed.
Operations/Production Department

To determine if damages were within the allowable limits.

To determine if branch was producing bread of good quality.

attributes.title: Vehicles fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
It was noted that fuel consumption for the period 1st May-17th June 2025 was within range except for two vehicles KDA 083 Z which consumed 3 litres more and Tuktuk KTWC 327Y which consumed 1 Litre more.

Below is a detailed summary :
attributes.recommendation: To ensure fuel allocation is done as per the standard rates and predetermined distance in kilometres.
attributes.effect: Minimal variations noted implies that fuel allocation controls are working effectively.

value: Fuel allocation to be done as per the standard rates and distance covered.
Fuel allocation to be done as per the standard rates and distance covered.
In the prior period dating 21/05/2025,it was noted Chokaa and Kayole 1 route vehicles had excess fuel consumption while all other vehicles’ consumption was within the set standard
Current
An analysis of vehicles fuel consumption was done from 1st May 2025 to 16th June 2025.
Fuel consumption was well managed.
Transport/Fleet Department
To determine if fuel allocation was being done as per the predetermined distance in kilometres  and standard rates for each motorvehicle.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption
attributes.description:
It was noted that generator fuel consumption was within range  however the generator did not run during the period under review  as per managers records and tracking system

Below is  a detailed summary of the audit findings.
attributes.recommendation: Generator fuel consumption controls to be maintained.

value: Controls in place to be maintained.
Controls in place to be maintained.

In the prior audit dated 19/06/2025,it was noted that the generator’s consumption rate as per the tracking system was 42 L/Hr while the physical records for February and March 2025 showed a different level of consumption in the 50-60 L/Hr
Current
A review of the fuel consumption rate for the branch for the period1st may 2025-18 June 2025 was done  to assess whether the consumption matched the standard consumption rate range.
Generator fuel consumption was well managed.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if generator fuel consumption was within the standard rates.

attributes.title: Debtors analysis.
attributes.description: A total of 105,631 debtors were noted which most were those of institutions as seen below:
attributes.recommendation: Sales team to follow up for clearance of the pending balances
attributes.effect: Minimal debt balances implies that debtors controls are working effectively.

value: Sales rep has been following up with the debtors balances for clearance.
Sales rep has been following up with the debtors balances for clearance.
In prior audit it was noted that the outstanding debt for customers and schools was KES 155,870.
Current
A review of debtors balances as at 18/06/2025 was done to identify any occurrences of bad debts per routes.
Debt balances were minimal/well controllled.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if there are any instances of bad debts or unresolved balances routewise.

attributes.title: Crates movement
attributes.description: It was noted that crates had nil variation as seen below:
attributes.effect: Nil variations implies that crates movement controls are working effectively.

value: Crates movement controls to be maintained.
Crates movement controls to be maintained.
In the prior audit it was observed that normal crates had nil variance compared with the book and +280 crates compared to the system records attributed to 280 yellow crates not booked in the system
A review of the crate balances at the branch was done on 16/06/2025 to establish and assess the existence and effectiveness of crate stock movement controls at the branch.
Crates movement controls working effectively.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if crates movement was being well managed.
